snippet: At a meeting in Arizona, federal and local law enforcement officials expressed sharp differences over the effect of declines in illegal border crossings.
abstract: Impact of steep declines in illegal migrants crossing the border with Mexico in recent years has rippled across Arizona and other border states, with federal and local law enforcement seeing big drops in crime related to illegal immigration; they face smaller numbers of more determined and potentially more dangerous crossers, including drug traffickers; federal and local officials express sharp differences over effect of declines in crossings.
lead_paragraph: At a meeting in Arizona, federal and local law enforcement officials expressed sharp differences over the effect of declines in illegal border crossings.

headline.seo: Illegal Migration From Mexico Falls, but Local Fears Persist
headline.main: Immigration Decreases, but Tensions Remain High
headline.print_headline: Immigration Decreases, But Tensions Remain High
